description:
Rubbish all over the bottom of Daneby Road as usual outside Ladbrokes: Rubbish all over the bottom of Daneby Road as usual outside Ladbrokes, where the patrons gather, drink in the street and eat takeaways then throw their rubbish on the floor. This is not getting regular cleaning and when it is occasionally swept up it is not done thoroughly and therefore remaining litter is an invite to deposit more here. It is a disgusting mess and needs regular attention. It attracts vermin and encourages further antisocial behaviour. Sort it out @lewishamcouncil #leeishamcounci . Why are we paying all this council tax? Residential road are only scheduled to receive once a week sweeping .

You say” Residential road are only scheduled to receive once a week sweeping . This is also subject to change particular at times like now when we have leaf fall season” I say - this street is lucky if it is swept once a month never mind weekly! If only it was swept weekly this problem would be greatly reduced. As far as saying it changes in leaf fall season? What do you mean? Last year you never came to sweep any leaves on the street, I had to clear my own part of the street and where people didn’t sweep up themselves large leaf drifts were there until the wind in April blew them away! When are we going to get value for money from our council tax? We are so sick of this, we will have to take it up with our MP if this is not addressed long term with a satisfactory service.

description:
TfL says this is LBL to resolve : Shelter at bus stop X Cambridge Drive towards Lewisham : shelter roof lighting not working: TfL says this is LBL to resolve : Shelter at bus stop X Cambridge Drive towards Lewisham : shelter roof lighting not working

Reported to TfL as reference FMS 3876536 07/10/22.

TfL has now closed the report saying "Our team had investigated this for you and found that this doesn't fall under the responsibility of Transport for London and comes under the remit of the local borough."

This shelter has been in darkness since February 2022 despite various reports to them each time.

LBL please pursue this and I am annoyed to be pushed between owners of the problem so please annotate that you either own this or have resolved directly with TfL who is going to fix the problem,. The shelter has a TfL ref number on it as you can see from the photographs and not a JC Decaux signage.

For avoidance of doubt it is this shelter:

Https://www.instantstreetview.com/@51.455179,0.017034,147.55h,0.32p,2.72z,J90pp1qTXG-_5OQv1YTxFw

Thank you
title: TfL says this is LBL to resolve : Shelter at bus stop X Cambridge Drive towards Lewisham : shelter roof lighting not working

All the trees in Aylward are badly overgrown from the base the the crown, they never used to be like this years ago, So i can only conclude that they are not being managed correctly, they need to be sorted out asap they are a big problem not only to the people who live in the road but also the people who are forced into the road because the trees are over grown all the way up the trunk from the ground to the crown, Also our road is being used as a rubbish tip because the trees conceal the rubbish being planted in them

Please get it fixed so we can get some sleep. Please do not mark this problem as fixed when nothing has been done about it.

There is a very dangerous wobbly fence on top of a large hill. The fence moves and is very close to homes below the hill. Non residents use the space in the fence as a short cut which damages the fence more making the gap bigger and wobbly. I originally reported this incident on 7th February 2022 to James however nothing has been done unfortunately and the fence continues to get weaker. The fence is now leaning back and is only a matter of time before it falls completely. Please can you advise. Many thanks

Massively overgrown weeds the length of Sprules Road: The pavements and curbs along the length of Sprules Road (on both sides) have been covered in weeds for the last 18 months. In summer 2021 residents spent over 20 hours de-weeding large stretches of the road by hand, and we have just spent more than this again and barely made a dent on the Vesta Road and Drakefell Road ends. The weeds are a tripping hazard for people unsteady on their feet, but they are also unsightly and perhaps that untidiness, and apparent lack of care for our surroundings, contributes to passersby feeling they can litter and fly tip along the length of the road. Finally, soil seems to accumulate where the road surface meets the curbside, and that again provides much food for new crops of weeds to sprout. We could dearly benefit from the council both weeding the pavements and cleaning the road.

title: Front garden a mess
description: Front garden a mess: Front garden of number 16 is a horrendous mess. Issue enforcement notice
detail: Front garden of number 16 is a horrendous mess. Issue enforcement notice

Hi there, apologies in advance if this type of report does not qualify for this channel. I'm not even sure if Lewisham deals with these types of issues (I've read that some councils do). Property 124, has a few untidy areas that need sorting. I've already reported fly-tipping at the front and here I'm reporting (1) an untidy terrace straight outside our bedroom window; and (2) an abandoned garden with blackberry aggressively spreading and overspilling into other properties/gardens. Again, apologies if this is not the right place to report such an issue. I do hope there's a chance that Lewisham council could encourage the owners to tidy up those areas. Thank you

My recent report on graffiti on buildings and shutters was responded to by Lewisham Council in that if I notified them of a particular building they would try to include that in their programe for cleaning due to not enough funding or staff to take on any large scale cleaning to clear it. It surely needs someone from LBC to look at the state of the High Street and come up with something more positive to clear the problem.

What's happened to the CCTV cameras in the High Street. I'm sure the shop keepers can offer some help, it can't do their business much good trading in such a messy Street. The police must know the tags and the names/addresses of the people causing the damage Shops should not be allowed to sell spray paint or marker pens to under 21's.

title: Bridge over the River Quaggy
description:
Bridge over the River Quaggy: The bridge over the River Quaggy is on the boundary of Bromley and Greenwich with Bromley being the highway authority for the bridge and to the east of the bridge. West of the bridge Lewisham is the highway authority, and north of the bridge Greenwich is the highway authority.

Shown in the picture is the shiny new 10T weight restriction sign installed at Bromley taxpayers' expense to the east of the bridge. There are no weight restriction signs to the north of the bridge (Greenwich) or to the west of the bridge (Lewisham).

Lewisham assert that the bridge now has a 40T weight limit (presumably believing it has been strengthened) and they gleaned this information from Bromley.

Either Bromley has squandered taxpayers' money on the new sign or Lewisham has made a mistake in removing the 10T limit signs.

To further confuse matters, there is a second bridge over the River Quaggy this time on Mottingham Lane, again on the boundary of Bromley and Greenwich, but with Greenwich the highway authority. Could it be that this bridge has the 10T limit.

Whatever the answer, this matter needs investigating as a matter of urgency, and the investigation should include liaising with Lewisham and Greenwich highway authorities to get to the bottom of this matter and ensuring that all three highway authorities display the correct signage for the bridge.

Lewisham assert that the bridge now has a 40T weight limit (presumably believing it has been strengthened) and they gleaned this information from Bromley.

Either Bromley has squandered taxpayers' money on the new sign or Lewisham has made a mistake in removing the 10T limit signs.

To further confuse matters, there is a second bridge over the River Quaggy this time on Mottingham Lane, again on the boundary of Bromley and Greenwich, but with Greenwich the highway authority. Could it be that this bridge has the 10T limit.

Whatever the answer, this matter needs investigating as a matter of urgency, and the investigation should include liaising with Lewisham and Greenwich highway authorities to get to the bottom of this matter and ensuring that all three highway authorities display the correct signage for the bridge.

title: Lewisham’s crews doing a sloppy job

Can someone please come put them back before this yard becomes a dump?! Thank you!

Pigeons have moved into the empty corner shop roof. There is in excess of 30 birds and its increasing. There is large amounts of droppings on the floor surrounding the shop. Pigeon droppings are toxic. They are becoming a nuisance for the surrounding properties too as the population increases.

description: Developer’s hoarding covered in graffiti: Green Developer’s hoarding on Morden Lane is covered in graffiti, which has now spread to nearby private properties, and wall which is part of a conservation area. Developer is negligent in their maintenance of this; they erected it so should also maintain it in an acceptable condition. Currently it’s damaging the area’s environment and bringing anti-social behaviour/ crime here as a result.
title: Developer’s hoarding covered in graffiti

The sections of pulled down fence are huge now and various issues as a result - people can get on to the land and damage/vandalise the scout hut & SINC site all listed with Lewisham as assets of community value. Rubbish being dumped on the site and pathway obstructed with fencing.

This pothole has been here for AGES. I reported a long time ago and it’s still not been fixed. It’s actually gotten bigger since I first reporter it and appears to be sinking. It sits next to what appears to be a water mains supply stopcock on the walkway in front of Lewisham Park Towers. It’s close to the front of the Kemsley block building.
title: Pothole
